result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Luis Ott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharge out of up to 25% prison funds. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  
Court did not order DNA surcharge.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. 
*Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration and Wisconsin Substance Abuse  Programs after serving two (2) years Initial Confinement in caes 15CF531, 15CF989 and 15CM677.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with Compassionate Doctor's Inc located at 1672 S. 9 Street, Milwaukee, WI; Walmart located at 3355 S. 27 Street, Milw. WI.; Blue Kangaroo Laundromat located at 1115 W. Greenfield Ave, Milw. WI.; Econo Lodge located at 6541 S. 13 Street, Milw. WI.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended supervison to be determined by DOC, but to include:  those as listed.

Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge as it has been ordered in case 15CF531.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Luis Ott

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC letter regarding mandatory DNA surcharge with notation indicating that the court will not alter the DNA surcharge order in this case.  DOC notified of the same by e-mail.
Original SENTENCING STATUS CONFERENCE Transcript (52 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 2, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Carolina L.  

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2.5 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 year with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1.5 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Compassionate Doctor's Inc. located at 1672 S. 9th St., Milwaukee, WI., Walmart located at 3355 S. 27th St. Milwaukee, WI., Blue Kangaroo Laundromat located at 1115 W. Greenfield Ave. Milwaukee, WI., Econo Lodge located at 6541 S. 13th St. Milwaukee, WI.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge as it has been ordered in case 15CF531.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 years initial confinement in cases 15CF531, 15CF989 and 15CM677.

Appeal rights given.    
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 1 & 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing Memorandum and Court Report, received and filed.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea date.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel in court and requests jury trial.  Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 26.  Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Letter from friend on behalf of the defendant filed.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp   Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-24-2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, Defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for Tyrone Martin St. Junior for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court with Michael Jude for attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW).  
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY ECONOLODGE LOCATION/JOSEPH H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
